demographics.diagnosis: Acute chronic CHF, LLE Cellulitis, Left shin venous ulcer

case_header.outcome: Successful Discharge to Home with Dual-Agency Coordination

clinical_logic.readiness_milestone: Wound healed sufficiently for home management; CHF/Cellulitis stabilized via SNF medication regimen
clinical_barriers: Open wound (Left shin venous ulcer) requiring specialized protocol
Chronic CHF requiring daily monitoring/telehealth coordination
Risk of 'double dipping' (insurance overlap) if HHA and Healing Partners visit on the same day

environmental_logic.physical_barriers: Not explicitly detailed; implies home environment was ready as patient had 'support at home'
bureaucratic_steps: PCP follow-up appointment scheduling by SW
Healing Partners Plus first visit scheduling (within 24hrs of D/C)
Regional Director outreach to home care providers for schedule alignment

timeline_deltas.context: Previous PN left; Melissa took over the Syracuse caseload. Most D/C work was pre-completed, requiring only verification of 'on target' status.
Coordination required to prevent HHA and Healing Partners from visiting on the same day to avoid insurance reimbursement failure.

reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Regional Director took over HHA coordination and schedule outreach
reasoning_trace_triples.intent: Maintaining continuity of care during vacancy
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Discharge remained on target despite lack of local PN for a period.

reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Communicated with HHA and SW to ensure alternating visit days
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Both agencies could be reimbursed; patient received consistent daily oversight.

reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Relied on SW and Regional Director's prior setup
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Handoff occurred smoothly, though PN lacked direct HHA contact info.

rank_1_best_practices.action: Ensuring Healing Partners Plus visit within 24 hours of SNF discharge
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: High-risk window for readmission is the first 48 hours post-transition.
Ensured the '2-4 week' estimate was met (Day 30) despite personnel changes.

rank_0_boundary_failures.action: Failure to explicitly verify HHA name and specific wound protocols personally
Strict 'No Overlap' rule resulting in potential 'zero eyes' days for CHF

unscripted_chaos_signals: HHA name/identity unknown to the current PN during the handoff process
Insurance billing constraints ('double dipping') dictating clinical visit schedules
